meanings.sent1: The brave knight reassailed the dragon after it woke up.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers reassailed the enemy camp at dawn.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel reassailed the bird feeder for more snacks.
meanings.sent4: The waves reassailed the shore with relentless force.
meanings.sent5: The persistent rain reassailed the city, flooding the streets.

meanings.definition: Confront or resist with determination and courage.
meanings.sent1: She reassailed her fears and stood up to the bully.
meanings.sent2: The protesters reassailed the unjust laws with peaceful demonstrations.
meanings.sent3: The little dog reassailed the big dog, barking loudly to protect its toy.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter reassailed the blazing building to save the trapped residents.
meanings.sent5: The hero reassailed the villain, ready to face any challenge.
